fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62074].
{panel}
h3. Problem definition

Users are able to attach images on transition screens. However when it comes to inserting them in the comments, the attachment icon *does not* appear on the comment panel, which could cause confusion, as shown in the image below:
!No-attachment-icon.png|thumbnail!

Include the attachment icon on the comment panel, as shown in the image below. This will allow the user to easily insert images in comments.

!attchment-icon.png|thumbnail!

h3. Note
 * The Attachment button will only appear on a Transition screen when there are existing attachments in the ticket, however, there's no option to browse and upload the attachment by clicking on the "+ Browse" link from the drop-down of the Attachment button. Hence, the workaround is to add the system Attachments field to the transition screen.
 * To upload an attachment during a transition, click on the "browse" link on the Attachments field to upload a file or use the drag and drop functionality. When the file is uploaded and present on the Transition screen, the Attachment button will be visible and user can choose to embed the file by clicking on the Attachment button and select the file.
* Adding attachments via drag-and-drop or copy-and-paste would also not work since it's not possible to add an attachment into a comment during a transition
fields.summary: Add ability to add attachments during transition to make it more intuitive
Set default Sub-Tasks view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62072].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Scheduled Jobs can be lost track when a database operation fails at the moment the job is claimed by the Scheduler. 

This only affects a single-node setup in Server, as in JIRA Data Center the "recovery" job will bring back to memory the lost jobs.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Server (Single Node - Non Data Center)
* JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Schedule a Job.
# Introduce a breakpoint at {{CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob}}
# Interrupt database connectivity.

h3. Actual Results
# JIRA will lose track of the job until a restart is performed.

h3. Expected Results.
# JIRA will run the job under its schedule as soon database connectivity is resumed

h3. Notes
This is the root caused behind the issue reported at JSD-3653 but could affect any scheduled job in JIRA.

h3.Workaround
Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Scheduled Jobs can be lost track of when a database operation fails at the moment the job is claimed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. As we fully manage any storage and database for you, this issue is not valid for Jira Cloud. If you are using JIRA Server, please [see the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62068].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently after each fresh installation of JIRA, it is required to manually perform the copying of Connector/J JDBC driver to the <JIRA installation directory>/lib/ directory.
h3. Suggested Solution

To provide a download option with user agreement and acknowledgement tick box during the installation of JIRA.
h3. Workaround
 # Get the MySQL driver:
 ** If you are installing JIRA, download the recommended MySQL driver JDBC Connector/J 5.1.
 You can download either the .tar.gz or the .zip file by selecting the 'Platform Independent' option. Extract the jar for the driver (e.g. mysql-connector-java-5.x.x-bin.jar) from the archive.
 ** If you are upgrading JIRA and you are not using the recommended MySQL driver (JDBC Connector/J 5.1), back up the driver from your JIRA installation before you upgrade.
 The driver will be in the <JIRA installation directory>/lib/ directory.
 # Copy the MySQL JDBC driver jar to the <JIRA installation directory>/lib/ directory for your new/upgraded installation. If you are installing JIRA using the Windows installer, you will need to do this step after running the Windows installer, but before running the setup wizard.
 # Restart JIRA / JIRA service.
fields.summary: Include Database JDBC Drivers into JIRA for MySQL

The [Last commented by a User Flag|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JTOOL/JIRA+Toolkit+Plugin] is awesomely useful for building a triaging filter that shows you issues that were last created or commented on by a user.

Unfortunately this is not only part of the JIRA Toolkit plugin but is hardcoded to mean 'users not in the jira-developers group'.

It would be very helpful to have this as part of JIRA Service Desk and remove the hardcoded group name.

Then, service desk administrators could configure additional filters/notifications based on the status of this field.
fields.summary: "Last commented by a User Flag" should be configurable and part of JIRA Service Desk

As an administrator, I believe it would be very useful to allow admins of the product to set different field descriptions for the same field in different screens. An example would be to have a description with instructions for adding a Comment that would only apply to a certain transition, whereas another transition would require a separate description with different instructions.

Example:
Transition A Comment Field - Please provide bug information
Transition B Comment Field (different screen) - Please provide feature request information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62056].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When entering time worked, it would be helpful if the time started, could be input so that the amount of time entered reflects when time was actually worked on an issue.


h3. Environment
Cloud / Server



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Click More
# Add work
# Enter time worked


h3. Expected Results
Time worked screen should allow a user to enter the time the work was actually started


h3. Actual Results
JIRA assumes that work is starting at that given time and there is no way to tell JIRA work started hours/minutes earlier

 
h3. Notes
This would extremely helpful if a developer performed work and then at the end of the day went through and entered their worked time. While JIRA will subtract their time from remaining hours, etc., it enters the time worked as starting at that very moment.


h3.Workaround
Currently time should be entered when it is actually starting.
fields.summary: Allow users to change when time worked was actually handled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62038].
  {panel}

h3. Description

When customer import a CSV file with a em dash (–) in the content, JIRA will treat it as invalid characters and import it as *?* into the system. Em dash (–) is an utf8 character and is a longer dash symbol than the normal dash ( - ). However, JIRA CSV importer treat it as a non utf8 character when importing the issue content. For details, please refer to this [documentation|http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/2014/index.htm].
 

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a CSV file which contains em dash (–) in description or summary field and save it.
 # Login JIRA and use CSV importer to import the CSV file
 # Ignore the warning message show during the import
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 # Check the issue after successfully imported the issue

 

h3. Expected result

!image-2016-07-26-21-57-53-941.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. 
h3. Actual result

!image-2016-07-26-21-57-17-439.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround
Replace all the em dash (–) to normal dash ( - ) in the CSV file and import
fields.summary: CSV import em dash (–) as invalid characters �

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , in order for the user to be added to Watcher list , they need to have *Browse Project* permission. By having the permission , they are allowed to view the entire project issue . The workaround is to configure the *Issue Security* to control the issue access . However , it still not recommended because admin needs to configure multiple levels .

fields.summary: Allow watcher only can view the ticket he/she been added to .

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Two dimensional filter statistics doesn't show the hyperlink for issues that are on Select List ( single choice ) of option "None" when the field is hidden
!unselectable.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type Select List ( single choice )
Eg: "Severity" with options "one", "two", "three"
# On a sample project, assign random issues values for this field
# Go to the dashboard and add Two dimensional filter statistics gadget. 
# On xaxis = Newly created custom field Eg: Severity
# On yaxis = Issue Type
# Now you should see the gadget and any issues that do not have a value for field "severity" will come under column *None*. These numbers under this column will have a hyperlink 
# Now go to the projects Field configuration and set the "severity" field to *hidden*
# Come back to the gadget on the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
You should still be able to get the hyperlink for issue that do not have a value for "severity" field

h3. Actual Results
The column "None" has now changed name to "Irrelavent" and the issues under them do not have a hyperlink as shown in the above screenshot.
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter statistics doesn't show the hyperlink for issues that are on Select List ( single choice ) of option "None" when the field is hidden

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62035].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Sometimes when a user tries to view their dashboards, the dashboard is empty without any configured gadgets displayed.


h3. Environment
* Happens more frequently in *Chrome* and *IE 11*


h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a *long list of dashboards* with couple of gadgets on each dashboard.
# Go to the Dashboard page, click on one of the dashboards from the list on the left panel.
# *Scroll on the mouse* while the dashboard is loading.


h3. Expected result
The selected dashboard and its gadgets will load properly.


h3. Actual result
* The selected dashboard is empty without any gadgets loaded, only the dashboard title and 3 functionality buttons (Add Gadget, Edit Layout, Tools) are displayed.
* Error {{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'left' of null}} is observed in the Browser Console


h3. Notes
* Clearing browser cache helps to bring back the dashboard with all gadgets temporarily
fields.summary: Dashboard fails to load with error "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'left' of null" appears in the browser console

h3. Environment

# Update the ticket via email.

The issue is being commented without {{text.html}} attachment

The content of the email header file:
{noformat}
Attachment: text.html
 <http://<base-url>:8080/browse/IT-1#add-comment> Add Comment
<http://<base-url>:8080/browse/IT-1#add-comment>
  
This message was sent by Atlassian JIRA (v6.4.8#64023-sha1:bab6790)



--B_3523450212_10300204

	charset="US-ASCII"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62015].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
Release version and view is associated with only one project.

*Example Scenario*
We are using JIRA to support multiple customers that are using our same product, some of those customers are using the same product version, and therefore are tied to a release cycle for that product version. Under the current implementation I am mapping customer issues to our product release on a JIRA project by project basis. This is fine for a customer-facing view. But there are scenarios where I have implemented a couple JIRA projects for 1 customer to accommodate their workflow. In this 2nd scenario looking at a release on a JIRA project by project basis fails.

*Requested Behaviour*
Allow to view multiple release version under one release view page. We can have this in board's release menu. Customer could define a product version, and under that have various releases versions. Then in any of the JIRA projects they would just tie the project to that product version(s), and thereafter be able to select fix version(s) from the list of releases that exist under that product version.
fields.summary: Release view that span multiple JIRA projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62012].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When CROWD is connected to JIRA for user management, the users that are pulled does not have a detail of where the uses belongs to and which user directory except that it shows that the user belongs to CROWD server.
 !Capture 2016-07-06 at 13.24.48.png|thumbnail! 

We need to log in to CROWD server every time we need to check which LDAP server or where the users is actually linked to.
 !Capture 2016-07-06 at 13.26.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

There is no suggested solution.
fields.summary: Displaying User Directory Details.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62009].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA, user is allowed to choose to add specific days from the "Non Working Days". But this will affect all users and not specific users' "Working day" configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add feature to the "Working Days" to exclude user specific vacation days. For more detailed example, please refer here:

{quote}We'd like a way of adding individuals' holiday schedules and exclude these from the working time available calculation, such as when assigning tasks to a Sprint.
For example, 4 weeks with 37.5 hours = 150 hours per person, but with a 2-week vacation in the middle is only leaves 75 working hours for that person.{quote}

h3. Workaround 

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Agile planning taking planned vacations into account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62008].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

I would like to have a report or gadget to show the burndown graph by the total # of subtasks completed vs not completed for a particular sprint. So, for example, if I have a total of 40 subtasks for 10 stories that are included in Sprint 25, I would like to have the burndown graph or report for the total # of subtasks that are completed vs not completed for a specific sprint. So for sprint 25 week 1 (or whenever I run this report or gadget), it will show me the burndown graph completed vs not completed for a specific sprint at that time.

h3. Suggested Solution
None

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Burndown graph by the total # of subtasks completed vs not completed for a particular sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62007].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Pie Chart Gadgets do not display correct results when the selected statistic type is a custom field configured for more than one context with the same custom field values

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 6.4.3
* JIRA version 7.1.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Custom field(tested with check box type) and associate it to a project.
# Create a new context in the same custom field with the same values and associate it to a different project as shown in below image !customfieldcontex.png|thumnail!
# Create some issues by selecting values for the custom field.
# Create a filter for this project
# Add this filter to Pie Chart Gadget, and set this custom field as the statistics type

h3. Expected Results
The pie chart displays one row per custom field option.

h3. Actual Results
The pie chart displays multiple rows per custom field option as shown in the screenshot below !Pie Chart.png|thumnail!

h3.Workaround
Create separate filter for each Project which uses custom field with context and associate them in different Pie Chart
fields.summary: Pie Chart Gadgets do not display correct results for a custom field with more than one context with the same values
Closing all stories should trigger automatic closing of parent epic in Simplified workflows
Is there a way to automatically add a issue in two projects at a time in JIRA. For example: If i create a issue in "Sample-A" project that same issue will automatically create in "Sample-B" project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62001].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The left Filter panel on *search for issues* screen offers a dock/undock functionality, by clicking the arrows, as shown in the image below:
 !dock-undock-filter.png|thumbnail! 


To *undock* the panel, the user can click on the right angled arrows "*>>*" or hover over it. If the user hovers over it, the panel expands *temporarily* until the user moves away. 

This causes some confusions and is not user friendly to the end user. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the users with the ability to choose their preferences, *either* just by clicking the arrows, or just by hovering on it, but not both.
fields.summary: Dock/undock of the filter panel should be more user friendly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61999].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently JIRA does not allow a user to create an additional 'Attachment' type field. In the case where a customer wants to include this field in an 'Issue Collector' as a 'Required' field, the customer cannot as placing this requirement on the existing 'Attachment' field would alter this fields behavior for the entire JIRA instance.


h3. Environment
Cloud
Server


h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Goto: Administration > Issues > Custom Fields

or 

- Type G+G 
- Type in 'Custom Fields'
- Press 'Enter'


h3. Expected Results
When clicking the 'Add custom field' button, a user should be able to search for 'Attachment'
The user should be able to apply the same type of attributes to this field as they would with the already existing 'Attachment' field: Required, etc.


h3. Actual Results
When clicking the 'Add custom field' button and searching for 'Attachment' there are no results found as we currently do not allow for a custom field of the type 'Attachment' to be created

 
h3. Notes
In the case of requiring an attachment field within an 'Issue Collector' form, this is not possible as we do not outright expose the code for the 'Issue Collector'. This means that validating the 'Attachment' field is not possible as there is no way to attach the 'onClick' event to the form submission button
fields.summary: Allow custom attachment fields to be created for use within JIRA and Issue Collectors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61997].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Request the ability to use text instead of images to be shown on the *Priority* field of JIRA Issues.
When using the issue navigator, user informed that the default priority images can be confusing and was wondering if he could change them to keywords (like Critical, High, medium, low).

See on the screenshot below how the priority field is currently displayed on issue navigator:
 !image-2016-07-21-15-03-08-135.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to choose keywords instead of images on Issues Priority field and make these keywords to be shown on Issue navigator.
fields.summary: Ability to choose between text or image to display in JIRA Issue Priority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61996].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Finding out the current access that a user has is an important security feature in user management


h3. Suggested Solution 
An overview of all projects to which a user has access (with possible drill-down to determine the exact access rights for that project), would help immensely, and make the overall security process easier to control.


h3. Workaround
Use the permission helper but you have to choose an issue per project and you can check one project at the time, having many projects this can take quite some time.
fields.summary: It should be possible to see which projects a user has access to in JIRA
Reciprocally delete Issue Link between instances
Conditional Formatting for JIRA Dashboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61990].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Unable to Release *and* Archive a version in a single REST call

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a version in JIRA
# Make sure this version is NOT released and NOT archived
# Referring to [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/version-getVersion], run the following REST call using the {{PUT}} method with the below data: [http://localhost:8080/jira/rest/api/2/version/10000]
{code:java}
{
     "self": "http://localhost:8080/jira/rest/api/2/version/10000",
     "id": "10000",
     "description": "An excellent version",
     "name": "New Version 1",
     "archived": true,
     "released": true,
     "releaseDate": "2010-07-06",
     "overdue": false,
     "projectId": 10000
 }{code}

h3. Expected Results
# The details of the version is updated with the new values and is also Archived *and* Released

h3. Actual Results
# The details of the version is updated with the new values but is *only* released. It is not being archived. The following is the response
{code:java}
{
   "self": "http://localhost:8080/jira/rest/api/2/version/10000",
   "id": "10000",
   "description": "An excellent version",
   "name": "New Version 1",
   "archived": false,
   "released": true,
   "releaseDate": "2010-07-06",
   "userReleaseDate": "06/Jul/10",
   "projectId": 10000
 }{code}
# Running the *same* call again will archive the version

h3. Notes
# The same happens when unreleasing and unarchiving in a single rest call
#* The first call will unrelease it
#* The second call will unarchive it
# Does *not* happen in JIRA 6.4.12
 
h3. Workaround
Archive and Release the version in 2 separate REST calls
fields.summary: Unable to Release and Archive a Version in a single REST API Call
Create traceability of all Stories  to Test cases.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61987].
  {panel}

h3. Description

When JIRA sends a filter subscription email to an user with a Microsoft Exchange mail account, the issue status field is not rendered correctly and renders HTML markup in the email.
h3. Step to Reproduce
 # Configure an outgoing mail server
 # Create a filter
 # A user with a Microsoft Exchange mail account subscribes to the filter
 # Wait for JIRA to send the filter subscription mail
 # Open mail with outlook or online browser OWA

h3. Expected result

!image-2016-07-21-18-16-58-095.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Result

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
Filter subscription email is only broken for specific affected mail servers (e.g. exchance, mail.ru), other mail servers like gmail are unaffected.

 
h3. Workaround
* Change the email format from HTML to Text.
* Check if the affected mail server has advanced settings that allow you to configure HTML rendering, and see if settings can be tweaked to avoid modifying or simplifying the HTML source in such a way that it breaks.

h3. Notes
* JIRA 6.4.x filter subscription mails don't exibit this bug
* Problem seems to be related to the way the different mail servers try to simplify some complex html tags in the email source for rendering.
*Update*
* Similar issue is reproducible with mail.ru
fields.summary: Mail rendering error in filter subscription email with Microsoft exchange account and Mail.ru

h3. Problem Definition

In [Getting started with JIRA Core|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Getting+started+with+JIRA+Core] documentation, there's information shown below:

{quote}Project administrators are responsible for configuring their projects.

They can administer projects, change the look and feel, and make various configuration changes to the project. A project administrator can't create a project unless they're explicitly given this permission by an administrator.{quote}

This is bit misleading because this indicates that Project Administrator can create new project if JIRA Administrator gave them specific permission. The fact is, in order for anyone be able to create project in JIRA, they have to be JIRA Administrator.

h3. Suggested Solution

Edit the documentation below:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Getting+started+with+JIRA+Core

Replace the sentence below:

{quote}A project administrator can't create a project unless they're explicitly given this permission by an administrator{quote}

with something more accurate like:

{quote}A project administrator can't create a project unless they're explicitly given JIRA Administrator permission{quote}

h3. Workaround 

-
fields.summary: Change Project Administrator information in documentation

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61976].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian, I have two queries regarding the decision to remove anonymous view access to Agile boards:

Firstly, can product management please confirm that your product strategy still aligns with your company values; I specifically refer to two quoted company values that seem to, from a customer's perspective, have been ignored in the decision to remove anonymous access of agile boards and your approach to choosing not to communicate such a drastic change:
*"Don’t #@!% the customer"*
"Customers are our lifeblood. Without happy customers, we’re doomed. So considering the customer perspective - collectively, not just a handful - comes first." - Do you believe removing functionality that adversely affects the end user, whilst not communicating the intent before the fact in release notes or otherwise, aligns with this company value? Do you feel you have treat your customers fairly here?

"Open company, no bullshit" - Do you believe that withholding information on drastic product changes in your release notes constitutes an "Open company, no bullshit"?

Secondly, in the spirit of providing solutions and not just pointing out problems, I would like to know how Atlassian would view a community attempt to re-instate this functionality through a free JIRA Core plug-in released on the Atlassian Marketplace. Can you clarify and confirm that if the community does chose to create such a plug-in that allows anonymous users to view issues in a board format, functionality that was present in previous versions, that Atlassian will not remove this plug in from the Atlassian Marketplace?

Thank you for your responses so far and I especially look forward to Atlassian's comment on free community JIRA Core add-ons.
fields.summary: JIRA Core plugin terms & conditions

h3. Summary

Some users with visual disabilities will have to zoom in a significant percentage to be able to work as normal. JIRAs design when zoomed in isn't user friendly and gives users a hard time navigating and working with JIRA with all the pop ups in different pages in JIRA
h3. Suggestion

Improve on JIRAs design for users with visual disabilities. This includes having pop ups appear in less obstructive places.

Even better if users have an option to select in the profile page for those visually impaired. When this option is selected, JIRAs design will switch to a more user friendly interface while magnified at the same time. It should also handle pop up dialogs gracefully (eg. workflow editor when zoomed in, re-index dialog) so that it doesn't consume much UI space

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary
Originates for [SDS Bug ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3653]

After configuring [Receiving request by email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Receiving+requests+by+email] , performing the test in {{Application > Email Request}} returns 'No problems found with email settings configuration.Successfully connected to the specified email server.', however, when click on 'View Log' , nothing is showing in connectivity log tab and processing log tab.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
This can happen if any abrupt interruption occurs towards the database/JIRA itself.
* network issue towards DB


h3. Expected Results
Emails are able to be retrieved by JSD
Scheduled Service should be clever enough to perform a retry

h3. Actual Results
Emails are not able to be retrieved
Scheduled Service are stuck
 
h3. Notes
Looking at the [Scheduled Jobs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-jira-service-desk-incoming-mail-790960076.html#TroubleshootingJIRAServiceDeskIncomingMail-ScheduledJobs], the scheduled jobs seems to hangs and is not running (by referring to 'Next Run' date, compare with the real time of the server. The next run date/time will be backdated)
 !Selection_267.png|thumbnail! 

A Number of Root Cause investigation based on the error:
Fixing below issue can help to solve the issue as well (as a workaround)
{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, JOB_ID, JOB_RUNNER_KEY, SCHED_TYPE, INTERVAL_MILLIS, FIRST_RUN, CRON_EXPRESSION, TIME_ZONE, NEXT_RUN, VERSION, PARAMETERS FROM public.clusteredjob WHERE JOB_ID=? (FATAL: terminating connection due to administrator command)
{code}
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to establish a connection with the database. (IO Error: The Network Adapter could not establish the connection)
{code}
* This is due to DB is restarted/lost connection temporarily and JIRA was not restart together afterwards

{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to establish a connection with the database. (Unknown server host name 'xxx.yyy.corp.com'.)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.getConnection(SQLProcessor.java:399)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.prepareStatement(SQLProcessor.java:543)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.createEntityListIterator(GenericDAO.java:960)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:883)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findListIteratorByCondition(GenericHelperDAO.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:398)
{code}
* There are DNS/routing/network issue from JIRA to Database

h3.Workaround
*Restart JIRA*
fields.summary: Scheduled Jobs Unresponsive/Hangs e.g. mail handlers stop processing emails to create issues due to database connectivity interuptions

h3. Summary
When creating multiple issues in JIRA and using the 'Create Another' tick box, the first issue created will be ranked under the issue that is highlighted in the backlog. Subsequent tickets within the creation sequence will end up at the bottom of the backlog

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JIRA Software project
# Highlight an existing ticket in the backlog
# Click 'Create'
# Make sure the 'Create Another' tick box is selected
# Create multiple tickets
# Check the ranking of the issues

The first issue created is ranked immediately under the issue that was highlighted
All subsequent issues that were created in the series end up ranked at the bottom of the backlog

h3. Summary
The document:

*Set password requirements*
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Set+password+requirements

does not provide examples that are thorough enough for end users. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into a Cloud instance
# Go to User Management
# Click on Password Policy
# Change the password policy to Strong in this example

h3. Expected Results
Based on the example given in the above referenced documentation, the password requirements appear to be:

- Eight characters
- Two special characters
- No capital letters


h3. Actual Results
In testing it was found that the example given does in fact meet the requirements however, typing something other than this for example: 

{{jnmpli2!@}}

The above referenced password meets the requirements as well at the minimum level but this has nine characters. When removing one of the characters from this pattern, JIRA indicates it does not meeting the 'Strong' requirement.

Changing this example to: {{JNmpli2!@!2}} meets the requirements.
 
h3. Notes
It would be extremely helpful if the documentation included 'exact' examples on how passwords should look / their requirements.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61937].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Atlassian HTTP Client's callbacks' ThreadPoolExecutor doesn't queue callbacks, so it might reject tasks submitted to it during high load (when no threads available right at the moment of submitting a task). 
In such cases it throws {{java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException}} from the {{execute}} method in a submitting thread.
Apache HTTP Client doesn't expect that, so it throws {{org.apache.http.nio.reactor.IOReactorException}} when catching {{RejectedExecutionException}} and changes IOReactor status to STOPPED therefore preventing further requests being sent by this client bean.
One of the consequences is that WebHooks stop working after it happens.
h3. Environment

Any JIRA up to 7.2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable DEBUG logging for {{com.atlassian.httpclient}}
 # Set up an HTTP endpoint (preferably having a timeout of 30+ sec before responding)
 # Configure a WebHook against it
 # Make a bulk edit of 1000 issues
 # Cross the fingers
 # Repeat bulk edits until you see {{java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException}} in the logs.

h3. Expected Results
 - No {{java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException}} thrown
 - No {{org.apache.http.nio.reactor.IOReactorException}} thrown
 - All JIRA's outgoing HTTP requests (including webhooks) continue working

h3. Actual Results
 - Apache HTTP client's reactor status is STOPPED
 - Webhooks (as well as some other functionality) do not work

h3. Workaround

That might only *decrease the probability* of this issue, but not fix it completely:
 - Decrease the number of webhooks
 - Decrease the number of errors when calling webhooks (e.g. get rid of webhooks often throwing TimeoutExceptions, etc.)
 - Better hardware might also help *slightly*

Actions that help if the issue actually happened:
 - Disabling/enabling the Atlassian HTTP Client plugin
 *OR*
 - Restarting JIRA.

Note:
 - Disabling/enabling the Atlassian HTTP Client Plugin will trigger other plugins to be restarted. Scheduled a downtime to make sure it is not affecting users that using JIRA.
fields.summary: Atlassian HTTP client might stop working at high load

Ich habe am letzten Mittwoch mein Account selber erstellt und dann habe ich eine Bestätigungsemail bekommen. Laut diese ist mein User „yoanats“. 

Leider habe ich keinen Zugriff auf das was ich brauche. Und zwar - ich kann mich in JIRA einloggen, aber wenn ich auf „Create Issue“ clicke, muss ich als Project „ Mobile Portal Mkt Request“ auswählen. Mir wird aber diese Option überhaupt nicht gezeigt. Das Gleiche passiert mit Issue Type- ich muss als Issue Type „Content“ auswählen. Leider sehe ich diese Option nicht. Woran kann es liegen? Laut Christian Seifert habe ich Zugriff auf MPI und PORCONIN. 

Kannst du mir weiterhelfen?

Danke schön und VG
Yoana

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61931].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

Currently we have little information about conditions, validators and post-functions in [our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-Advanced_transitionsAdvancedtransitionconfiguration]. If there is a problem being caused by a validator or a condition and the customer is not aware of this configuration in his workflow, it may be problematic to find the issue.

h3. Expected behaviour

The JIRA Admin Helper tool could include a workflow verification step so we could avoid customer's effort to find the problem.
fields.summary: Include workflow validation in JIRA Admin Helper
